description.narrative: IFC''s investment is consistent with the World Bank 2012-15 ICT strategy and will help to: (i) expand the local IT markets'' (ii) provide quality employment; and (iii) promote affordable IT solutions to help large public and private organizations as well as SMEs run more efficiently.

TeamNet specializes in the development, implementation and integration of software applications based-on existing commercial solutions and proprietary IT systems. TeamNet International S.A. is a privately owned company registered in Romania. The Company is seeking EUR 25-30 million in a combination of equity and debt to finance its growth in the Eastern European (EE) region. The funds will be used to: (i) upgrade its existing technical platform and products; (ii) increase capacity of its existing operating subsidiaries in the EE region; (iii) fund potential acquisitions in the EE region with a view to acquiring personnel with strong technical skills; and (iv) provide working capital and restructure of TeamNets short-term debt in order to better match its funding needs with its pipeline of contracts. In 2012 the company introduced a new business line, Ymens Cloud Services, which targets private sector SMEs to provide business applications such as accounting, corporate mail, payroll, using a transaction-based pricing model. The Project will support the further roll out of the Ymens Cloud service in Romania and in other countries where the Company has a presence.

name.narrative: TeamNet International S.A. is headquartered in Bucharest, Romania and has presence throughout the country as well as in Turkey, the Western Balkans and Moldova. The Project will expand the Companys existing business lines into these markets.
